results.title: Lotte Reiniger Compilation
results.brief_description: A compilation of works by silhouette animator Lotte Reiniger. “Carmen” Carmen entices the soldier, Don Jose, to the gypsy encampment where she steals his clothes. “Aladdin and the Magic Lamp” - The Arabian Nights story of Aladdin. “Gallant Little Tailor” - A little tailor, plagued by flies kills seven of them at one stroke . “Grasshopper and the Ant” - The grasshopper plays his fiddle all summer, but when winter comes he realises his error. Jack and the Beanstalk” - Traditional fairytale. “Little Chimney Sweep - Fairytale about a little chimney sweep. “Papageno” - From Mozart’s “Magic Flute”. “Puss in Boots”. “Snow White and Rose Red” - Snow White and Rose Red befriend a bear who later claims to be a prince under a spell.

results.title: Lothersdale: an image of England
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Patricia Meehan
results.brief_description: Looks at Lothersdale, an epitome of England, and examines the life and work of this village. The mill and other industries are viewed, while the economic problems of farmers are examined.

results.title: Lost pigeon
results.creator_credit: Arthur Barr Productions and A McDonald
results.brief_description: A young boy finds a lost homing pigeon in a nearby vacant lot. The pigeon’s rightful owner advertises for his return, but the rescuer is unwilling to give up the bird, which he has tenderly looked after. The film explores the concepts of ownership and responsibility for one’s actions. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Lost on Everest
results.brief_description: On 8 June 1974 George Mallory and Andrew Irvine left their tent high on the slopes of Mount Everest and climbed into history. They were seen at 12.50pm, just 240 metres from the summit. Within minutes Mallory and Irvine had disappeared and were never seen again. For the next 75 years what had happened to them remained a mystery in the history of mountaineering. This documentary follows the BBC sponsored expedition in March 1999 to the North Face of Everest, in search of Mallory and Irvine, and explores the answers to the questions - could these two pioneering climbers have reached the summit, 29 years before Sir Edmund Hillary and Sherpa Tenzing Norgay? When and how did they perish?

results.title: Lost in translation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: American Zoetrope, Elemental Films, Ross Katz and Sofia Coppola
results.brief_description: Two kindred spirits, both hitched but essentially partnerless, seek solace and distraction in this updated take on “Brief encounter”. Bill Murray simply excels as Bob - a jaded film star whose career and marriage are sagging whilst he vaguely goes through the motions, resigned to the humiliations and compromises of middle age. Charlotte by contrast, still struggles with disappointment, set in early, of her marriage and the irony of her loneliness. The visual overload of a vibrant, tasteless, seedy, bustling, 24/7 Tokyo provides the backdrop to the pair’s melancholia and united quietude. Sophia Coppola was nominated for Best director, winning an Academy Award for her wonderfully droll and witty screenplay. Also stars Giovanni Ribisi. Also available on VHS [318955].

results.title: Lost in Translation
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The double movement of displacement and circulation, loss and regeneration, constitutes a means of uncovering the disjunction between history and memory [in Latin America].’ - Charles Merewether.

The cartographer’s ‘invention’ of the world and the role of slavery in the process of the colonisation of South America form an ‘anti-historical’ reconstruction of ‘Brazil’.

Produced in association with the Australian Film Commission.
Notes reprinted courtesy of d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: Lost in the bush
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, E.J. Perry and Peter Dodds
results.brief_description: A film based on an actual incident. In 1864 three young children belonging to a small squatting family wandered far from home and found themselves lost in the Australian outback. The film concentrates on the children’s struggle to survive in the bush and on the search mounted by their family to find them. Based on the account of the search written by Les Blake in the 1860’s. Cast includes Gabrielle Bulle, Colin Freckleton, Richard McClelland.

results.title: Lost in space
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Mark W Koch, Stephen Hopkins, Akiva Goldsman and Carla Fay
results.brief_description: In the not too distant future, earth is on the verge of total collapse and survival lies on colonising outer space. All hope rests on the Robinson family, whose mission is to establish life on Alpha Prime, the only other habitable planet in the galaxy. However when their spacecraft is sabotaged by a traitor, they find themselves lost in space and flying headlong into some out of this world dangers. Cast includes William Hurt, Gary Oldman, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Heather Graham and Lacey Chabert.

results.title: Lost in La Mancha
results.creator_credit: Quixote Films, Low Key Pictures, Lucy Darwin, Keith Fulton and Louis Pepe
results.brief_description: A documentary about the failed production of a feature film directed by Terry Gilliam that was to be called “The Man Who Killed Don Quixote”. The documentary takes us through the pre-production process from storyboards and script development to costume and set design. Leading up to the start of production all that is missing are the actors! The all-star cast would have included Johnny Depp, Jean Rochefort and Vanessa Paradis. Only six days into production the film strikes a series of events of bad luck, which include Acts of God, cast illness, insurance complications and staff quitting. After developing the film for ten years, director Terry Gilliam looses ownership of his script and the whole project is abandoned. A very useful tool to those teaching/studying filmmaking, this documentary explains the process of feature filmmaking and its inherent risks. Includes interviews with key members of the production, including Australian 1st AD Phil Patterson. Narrated by Jeff Bridges. Two-disc set with over four hours of special features.
